quote: Being famous gets me good concert tickets, good tables in restaurants, good seats at sporting events and that's really about it.
author: Fran Drescher

quote: Being famous is wicked. But it's better to be normal.
author: Rupert Grint

quote: I am the most well-adjusted human being I know. I started out this investigation as a very happy man with a great career. I've got the life people dream about: I am rich, I am famous, I've got a fabulous marriage to an absolutely, spell-bindingly brilliant woman.
author: James Ellroy

quote: I was with a famous comedian when a young fan walked up and asked for an autograph. The comedian blew him off. I'll never forget the look on the young boy's face. He was devastated.
author: Louie Anderson

quote: You know, one of the biggest thrills I have is when famous people recognize me from Taxi.
author: Marilu Henner

quote: It isn't false modesty when I say this, but although I am supposed to be a famous person it doesn't mean anything to me. I just sit at home and work.
author: Gyorgy Ligeti

quote: I think the driving thing was curiosity about the universe. That fascinated me. I didn't think anything about being famous or anything like that, I was just interested in the concepts involved.
author: Clyde Tombaugh

quote: Famous people come up to me, but I don't know who they are because my sight is so bad. It's always at the pool of the Four Seasons in Beverly Hills when I don't have my lenses in and my glasses are in my room.
author: Helena Bonham Carter

quote: If you look closely, there is no book more visual than Three Trapped Tigers, in that it is filled with blank pages, dark pages, it has stars made of words, the famous magical cube made of numbers, and there is even a page which is a mirror.
author: Guillermo Cabrera Infante

quote: Thus, after finishing high school, I started with high expectations and enthusiasm to study chemistry at the famous Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Zurich.
author: Richard Ernst

quote: Sometimes being famous gets in the way of doing what you want to do.
author: Johnny Mathis

quote: When you're famous, you don't get to meet people because they want you to like them when the present themselves to you, and you don't see the real people.
author: Cass Elliot

quote: I did grow up next door to Steve McQueen, who was a very famous movie star at the time, but as a kid it didn't impress me. We always had great fun with him. He would take us out on Sundays on his motorcycles, riding around in the desert; he was like a second father.
author: Herb Ritts

quote: Know the names of past and current artists who are most famous for playing their instruments.
author: Marilyn vos Savant

quote: I feel very strong as an individual, but as a famous footballer I know I am prone to certain things. All the media have a continuous interest for me. It varies from once a year to every day interest.
author: Ruud van Nistelrooy

quote: I am famous because I am an African American jazz artist.
author: Nat King Cole

quote: I didn't want to be famous. I just wanted to earn enough money to have a nice life and enjoy acting.
author: David McCallum

quote: The most famous person in my phone is Lindsay Lohan. We starred in 'Confessions of a Teenage Drama Queen' together in 2004 and we've stayed in touch.
author: Adam Garcia

quote: I'm famous by default. I came out of the womb, and people wanted to know who I was because of my parents.
author: Frances Bean Cobain

quote: The problem is, the more famous you get, the more people see you who didn't choose to.
author: Louis C. K.

quote: My dear Mama, you are definitely the hen who hatched a famous duck.
author: Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec

quote: Being rich and famous has never been my goal at all. I love to act and I want to be able to do really great parts.
author: Jenn Proske

quote: A window covered with raindrops interests me more than a photograph of a famous person.
author: Saul Leiter

quote: If I wasn't even famous or had any success, I would still wake up and put tons of make-up on, and put on a cool outfit. That's always been who I've been my whole life, so that's never gonna change. I love fashion. I love getting dressed up. I love Halloween, too.
author: Gwen Stefani

quote: I like photographing the people I love, the people I admire, the famous, and especially the infamous. My last infamous subject was the extreme right wing French politician Jean-Marie Le Pen.
author: Helmut Newton

quote: I think in the end, when you're famous, people like to narrow you down to a few personality traits. I think I've just become this ambitious, say-whatever's-on-her-mind, intimidating person. And that's part of my personality, but it's certainly not anywhere near the whole thing.
author: Madonna Ciccone

quote: Thank God I arrived the day before yesterday, the first of the month, at this port of San Diego, truly a fine one, and not without reason called famous.
author: Junipero Serra

quote: You do not want to get married at 22! Especially if you're famous, because girls are going to be throwing themselves at you.
author: Usain Bolt

quote: The hardest thing about being famous is that people are always nice to you.
author: Robert De Niro

quote: In American military cemeteries all over the world, seemingly endless rows of whitened grave markers stand largely unvisited and in silence. The gardeners tend the lawns, one section at a time. Even at the famous sites, tourism is inconstant.
author: Mark Helprin

quote: I find it weird the way people get so excited about celebrity. If my friends are on the phone, their friends will say: 'Is that kid from 'Love Actually' there?' And the phone gets passed round and I have to speak to this stranger asking: 'Are you famous?' I don't know how to answer.
author: Thomas Sangster

quote: In its famous paradox, the equation of money and excrement, psychoanalysis becomes the first science to state what common sense and the poets have long known - that the essence of money is in its absolute worthlessness.
author: Norman O. Brown

quote: Aristotle was famous for knowing everything. He taught that the brain exists merely to cool the blood and is not involved in the process of thinking. This is true only of certain persons.
author: Will Cuppy

quote: When you're rich and famous you are the dominant force in a relationship, even if you try hard not to be. I've talked of sacrificing everything for Fleetwood Mac, but I realize now that it is simply the only thing I've ever wanted to do.
author: Stevie Nicks

quote: I'm actually about as famous as a fourth division footballer from the 70s.
author: Dylan Moran

quote: I fear that, in the end, the famous debate among materialists, idealists, and dualists amounts to a merely verbal dispute that is more a matter for the linguist than for the speculative philosopher.
author: Moses Mendelssohn

quote: I try to become more humble and more myself with every year. There was a while when I got famous where I was so confused and my head was spinning.
author: Mira Sorvino

quote: It's always a little mind-boggling to realize that these famous actors know who I am.
author: Emily Blunt

quote: Being in 'Us Weekly' does not make you famous.
author: Bradley Cooper

quote: It's too late for me to get married before I'm famous. You never know people's intentions.
author: Carmelo Anthony

quote: Celebrity culture, it's everywhere, isn't it? It's reality TV, Big Brother. I didn't become a footballer to be famous, I became a footballer to be successful. I didn't want to be famous. Now people want to be famous. Why? Why would you want people following you about all day?
author: Ryan Giggs

quote: In fact, I'd just like to own something. Everyone thinks I'm glamorous, rich and famous but all I've got is some recording equipment and a battered old BMW.
author: Dido Armstrong

quote: I love being famous - it's phenomenal.
author: Dave Chappelle

quote: You want a hero in the music world? James Brown. He brought a feeling to music without really using words. He's just famous for his sound.
author: David Lee Roth

quote: I have a great job writing for 'The Office,' but, really, all television writers do is dream of one day writing movies. I'll put it this way: At the Oscars the most famous person in the room is, like, Angelina Jolie. At the Emmys the huge exciting celebrity is Bethenny Frankel. You get what I mean.
author: Mindy Kaling

quote: I got very famous for a minute and then it just all went away, you know? And for the last 20 years - you've got to pick yourself up and dust yourself off and then go on your merry way and start again, in a sense, and that's what I've been doing.
author: Colin Hay

quote: In the sixties, everyone you knew became famous. My flatmate was Terence Stamp. My barber was Vidal Sassoon. David Hockney did the menu in a restaurant I went to. I didn't know anyone unknown who didn't become famous.
author: Michael Caine

quote: It's sour grapes, I admit, I want to be more famous so people are examining my work couplet by couplet, you know what I mean? That's the level where I want to go.
author: Frank Black

quote: Anytime you cast a movie and you need someone famous in the lead part, you're a prisoner of whoever happens to be famous in the six-month window in which you're trying to get a film financed.
author: Alexander Payne

quote: I don't need to be wildly famous for my life to make sense.
author: Cory Monteith

quote: I can read a crowd pretty well. I know what to play and know how to keep it interesting for them and for myself as well. Most of the other DJs are more like producers so they become famous because they make hits and then they start DJ-ing. But I'm more from the other way around.
author: Tiesto

quote: I have no sense of being famous - you're just working. And then you'll have a random day in London when you'll do some press and it creeps into your awareness that this goes out - that what you do every day goes out to televisions right across the country.
author: Karen Gillan

quote: I was there when the quote-unquote golden age of musical theater was flourishing. I met everybody who worked in theater or was famous in theater from the '40s on.
author: Harold Prince

quote: If you wanna be famous, then it's okay if the music is fake, because fame isn't real.
author: Josh Homme

quote: I'm a regular person. I know a lot of people love being famous. I don't like it. I'm just chillin'. YouknowwhatI'msayin'?
author: Wale

quote: I grew up on my dad's sets, but I was never star-struck or desperate to be famous. I grew up being a worker. It took me a long time to realise that my work ended up being seen by people. As far as I was concerned, I was just in the family business.
author: Katharine Isabelle

quote: Why should it matter to us when wrestlers are found dead in their beds or seen limping around on two fake hips? Why should it matter to us that there's a list of modern wrestlers who died before the age of 50 - many of them famous - and that the list is more than 70 names long? Hey, there's always another wave of guys on the way. Always.
author: Bill Simmons

quote: Liverpool people are famous for liking clothes and fashion; they are very social and lively people, and we know that they like clothes.
author: Vivienne Westwood

quote: I think it would collapse my heart if I was super famous. I don't have the nerve for it, I'm too anxious. I don't know how you're not obsessed with how people perceive you, because they're real people, you know? You can convince yourself that they don't really know you, and that's true, but how can it not hurt your feelings?
author: Bo Burnham

quote: There are some famous people, and I've met them, who you might think are great, and then you meet them, and you discover that they not only have feet but heads of clay.
author: Anne Beatts

quote: Jack Palance was my distant uncle - that's the family gossip. Growing up, my family knew everything about his face getting burned and scarred in the military and how that mutilation led him to become such a famous 'heavy' in films. I prayed for good scars of my own. Not just acne scars.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: I think people I'm close to find it absolutely crazy that I'm famous.
author: Zayn Malik

quote: I've always been passionate about acting. I haven't been passionate about being famous.
author: David Alpay

quote: I liked myself much more before I got famous. I was much friendlier and had more energy.
author: Sia Furler

quote: John Muir, the famous naturalist, wrote in his journal that you should never go to Alaska as a young man because you'll never be satisfied with any other place as long as you live. And there's a lot of truth to that.
author: Tom Bodett

quote: First of all, plain and simple, you have no real idea of what it means to be famous until you become famous. It's a double-edged sword. Obviously there are a lot of amazing things about fame, but there are also a lot of challenging things about it.
author: Michelle Pfeiffer

quote: I'm an instant star. Just add water and stir.
author: David Bowie

quote: If there's anything more mortifying than being famous at 14, it's being washed up right after.
author: Moon Unit Zappa

quote: A library, to modify the famous metaphor of Socrates, should be the delivery room for the birth of ideas - a place where history comes to life.
author: Norman Cousins

quote: I had to do this very aggressive, big score in a very short time, and knowing that in the beginning, middle, and end would be this very, very famous theme, but I still had to weave a score around it and make it work as a score was really challenging.
author: Danny Elfman

quote: The same people who can deny others everything are famous for refusing themselves nothing.
author: Leigh Hunt

quote: Other famous men, those of much talk and few deeds, soon evaporate. Action is the dignity of greatness.
author: Jose Marti

quote: Pulp existed for 12 years before we got famous. Now, you could say that was just lack of imagination, but it's some kind of quality isn't it? Tenacity. You could also say it was sloth.
author: Jarvis Cocker

quote: The advantage of taking pictures of the famous is that they get published.
author: Elliott Erwitt

quote: I was the big, bossy older sister, full of enthusiasms, mad fantasies, desperate urges to be famous, and anxious to be a saint - a settled sort of saint, not one who might have to suffer or die for her faith.
author: Maeve Binchy

quote: I had a beautiful mother and a famous father, and I didn't know where I fit in.
author: Elle King

quote: They eat the dainty food of famous chefs with the same pleasure with which they devour gross peasant dishes, mostly composed of garlic and tomatoes, or fisherman's octopus and shrimps, fried in heavily scented olive oil on a little deserted beach.
author: Luigi Barzini

quote: Acting is not about being famous, it's about exploring the human soul.
author: Annette Bening

quote: Being famous is having the power to really implement positive change in the world, and it gives you the power to do what you want. I'm really grateful for it because I can play music and people will listen.
author: Sean Lennon

quote: Don't worry about writing a book or getting famous or making money. Just lead an interesting life.
author: Michael Morpurgo

quote: I seldom read anything that is not of a factual nature because I want to invest my time wisely in the things that will improve my life. Don't misunderstand; there is nothing wrong with reading purely for the joy of it. Novels have their place, but biographies of famous men and women contain information that can change lives.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: Since I was seventeen I thought I might be a star. I'd think about all my heroes, Charlie Parker, Jimi Hendrix... I had a romantic feeling about how these people became famous.
author: Jean-Michel Basquiat

quote: Mum loves me being famous! She is so excited and proud, as she had me so young and couldn't support me, so I am living her dream, it's sweeter for both of us. It's her 40th birthday soon and I'm going to buy her 40 presents.
author: Adele

quote: Yeah, I love being famous. It's almost like being white, y'know?
author: Chris Rock

quote: Before I was famous, when I was just working in Gilbert's Lodge, everything was moving in slow motion.
author: Eminem

quote: Celebrity was a long time in coming; it will go away. Everything goes away.
author: Carol Burnett

quote: The celebrity is a person who is known for his well-knownness.
author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quote: Passion for fame: A passion which is the instinct of all great souls.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Celebrity is the chastisement of merit and the punishment of talent.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: I do not like the man who squanders life for fame; give me the man who living makes a name.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Fame is the thirst of youth.
author: Lord Byron

quote: I think that when you are famous every weakness is exaggerated.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Celebrity distorts democracy by giving the rich, beautiful, and famous more authority than they deserve.
author: Maureen Dowd

quote: A very quiet and tasteful way to be famous is to have a famous relative. Then you can not only be nothing, you can do nothing too.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: What a heavy burden is a name that has become too famous.
author: Voltaire

quote: I have as much privacy as a goldfish in a bowl.
author: Princess Margaret

quote: I woke up one morning to find I was famous. I bought a white Rolls-Royce and drove down Sunset Boulevard, wearing dark specs and a white suit, waving like the Queen Mum.
author: Peter O'Toole

quote: If you want to be a rock star or just be famous, then run down the street naked, you'll make the news or something. But if you want music to be your livelihood, then play, play, play and play! And eventually you'll get to where you want to be.
author: Eddie Van Halen

quote: I've had to deal, a lot, with my own sense of intimidation at meeting famous people - especially actors, but really any famous people.
author: Charlie Kaufman

quote: I never wanted to be famous.
author: Dave Attell

quote: When famous people come up to you it's a bit weird, but it's an honour, really, when they recognise you and want to chat to you for a bit.
author: Wayne Rooney

quote: In the beginning, I loved being famous, but now I am tired of it and I would like to go back to my freedom.
author: Roberto Cavalli

quote: There are a lot of famous comedians from Liverpool, then obviously the Beatles, and the football club. That's what people in Liverpool are passionate about.
author: Ian Rush

quote: I'm willing to make compromises based on someone I think is the one, but I think it's psychologically important to people when they're famous to be the only famous person they know.
author: John Mayer

quote: I love being famous. It's almost like being white.
author: Chris Rock

quote: I had no desire to be famous; I just wanted to make the greatest music ever made. I didn't want anyone to know who I was.
author: Robert Smith

quote: I can deal with it now, but 13 is a tough age to be recognized and famous. It's a tough age, period.
author: Bill Skarsgard

quote: It's interesting because people assume that because I'm famous I know all famous people.
author: Daniel Radcliffe

quote: I have so much empathy for these young actors that are 19 and all of a sudden they're beautiful and famous and rich. I'm like, 'Oh my God, I'd be dead.'
author: Philip Seymour Hoffman

quote: There is this power that comes with being famous.
author: Rod Stewart

quote: Being famous before you've formed your personality, before you have that self-esteem, is dangerous.
author: Chris Evert

quote: When you're a famous, successful person at 16 years old, the rules change for you. Everybody is doing things for you to make life easier so you can go out and play. And I think you miss out on lot of growing up and a lot of reality checks.
author: Chris Evert

quote: I really feel like it's a travesty to make a child famous. I really do.
author: Joe Rogan

quote: I had a sense of who I was before I got famous.
author: Joe Rogan

quote: Exposure makes you famous, not just good work. Famous is being plastered everywhere.
author: Francesca Annis

quote: Being very famous is not the fun it sounds. It merely means you're being chased by a lot of people and you lose your privacy.
author: Colin Wilson

quote: When you look at Michael Jackson, there's nobody who loves him in that family, nobody. If they did, they'd tell him he didn't have to do all that in order to be famous. All he has to do is keep doing his music and be himself. Michael's been a little touched for about 20 years, but somebody needs to pull him aside and tell him they love him.
author: Jamie Foxx

quote: I never dreamt of being a musician for my livelihood. I certainly never would have wanted to be in the business that I'm in, meaning the fame and the glory, the glitter, the rock star, the famous part.
author: Eddie Van Halen

quote: Few would argue that Richard Dawkins is the world's most famous atheist, especially now that his friend and rival for the title, Christopher Hitchens, has now gone to meet his Maker.
author: Ray Comfort

quote: I always thought it was strange when these artists like Kurt Cobain or whoever would get really famous and say, 'I don't understand why this is happening to me.' There is a mathematical formula to why you got famous. It isn't some magical thing that just started happening.
author: Chad Kroeger

quote: Luckily, I think, I never really wanted to be famous, I just wanted to make movies.
author: Seth Rogen

quote: I remember, when I was an up-and-coming comic, how annoyed I would be when the famous guys would show up and just take everyone's spots.
author: Seth Rogen

quote: I'm coming out with a wine... I'm actually a restaurateur. I have Famous Famiglia Pizzeria that has opened up in the Sacramento airport. I'm also working with my business partner on opening up the Linnethia Lounge.
author: NeNe Leakes

quote: My ultimate dream is to become a famous star because I love to sing.
author: Lucy Hale

quote: I had a very happy childhood, happy teenage years and I was famous by the time I was 22. A charmed life.
author: Rik Mayall

quote: I am not hugely famous; I am not a name. For me, it's not the size of the role, it's the material and the people you are working with.
author: Ruth Negga

quote: On the banks of the Nile, the Rosetta branch, I lived an enjoyable childhood in the City of Disuq, which is the home of the famous mosque, Sidi Ibrahim.
author: Ahmed Zewail

quote: Athol Fugard became famous as a playwright, so although 'Tsotsi' the book was written in the '60s, it was only published in the '80s. It was then optioned pretty much every year by producers. I think the problem was that holding onto its period setting made it very hard to get finance.
author: Gavin Hood

quote: I don't see myself as a famous person.
author: Jess Glynne

quote: Martyrdom is the only way a man can become famous without ability.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: I don't like being recognised, I have no interest in being famous at all, I just do what I do. If I could be like Captain Kirk and beam myself up and then beam myself down, I would!
author: Bruce Dickinson

quote: We had an interesting thing at that first dinner. It was prior to the availability of several new hotels in Los Angeles, and we were more or less committed to the old Ambassador Hotel that has the famous Coconut Grove.
author: Lew Wasserman

quote: I'm following my dreams and doing what I love as a designer. I did not want to be one of those kids with a famous last name that doesn't do anything. That is very unfulfilling to me and I'm very happy.
author: Nicky Hilton

quote: I don't know about this thing - being famous. I haven't figured it out yet. It still mystifies me.
author: Helen Slater

quote: Yeah, I like to be the maker of the art. And I like and want the money. But I don't really dig being famous.
author: Liz Phair

quote: To put it simply - you know, a lot of people believe that the benefit of this job is fame and fortune. I believe that you pay for the fortune through the fame. I don't buy into the notion that being famous is somehow a good thing, or an exciting thing, or a wonderful thing.
author: Evangeline Lilly

quote: I don't think about being famous, really. Being an author, I don't generally get stopped as I walk down the street. It's not like being a movie star.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: I come from a family with a long tradition in shoemaking, and I still live in a region famous for its shoemakers. It is getting harder and harder to find skilled workers. There are no professional training institutes, so we have to train our own employees. And an apprenticeship takes three years.
author: Diego Della Valle

quote: I feel strongly about HIV/AIDS and children because I'm a famous singer, a public figure, and I'm a female and a mother. I have the responsibility and the passion to help out and do whatever I can.
author: Peng Liyuan

quote: My name is not big enough for people to go, 'Let me throw money at you because you're so famous!'
author: Nikki Reed

quote: When I was growing up I loved reading historical fiction, but too often it was about males; or, if it was about females, they were girls who were going to grow up to be famous like Betsy Ross, Clara Barton, or Harriet Tubman. No one ever wrote about plain, normal, everyday girls.
author: Kathryn Lasky

quote: Being famous is just like being in high school. But I'm not interested in being the cheerleader. I'm not interested in being Gwen Stefani. She's the cheerleader, and I'm out in the smoker shed.
author: Courtney Love

quote: Fame is a fickle food upon a shifting plate.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: We all want to be famous people, and the moment we want to be something we are no longer free.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quote: I never wanted to be famous. I only wanted to be great.
author: Ray Charles

quote: Power is not of a man. Wealth does not center in the person of the wealthy. Celebrity is not inherent in any personality. To be celebrated, to be wealthy, to have power requires access to major institutions.
author: C. Wright Mills

quote: I wanted to be a rich, famous rock-and-roll star in that order.
author: Dee Snider

quote: America is known as a country that welcomes people to its shores. All kinds of people. The image of the Statue of Liberty with Emma Lazarus' famous poem. She lifts her lamp and welcomes people to the golden shore, where they will not experience prejudice because of the color of their skin, the religious faith that they follow.
author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg

quote: Having bodyguards is just part of being famous, I think.
author: Dolph Lundgren

quote: Glory is fleeting, but obscurity is forever.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Everybody wants to be famous, but nobody wants to do the work. I live by that. You grind hard so you can play hard. At the end of the day, you put all the work in, and eventually it'll pay off. It could be in a year, it could be in 30 years. Eventually, your hard work will pay off.
author: Kevin Hart

quote: The American Dream is a term that is often used but also often misunderstood. It isn't really about becoming rich or famous. It is about things much simpler and more fundamental than that.
author: Marco Rubio

quote: You might not make it to the top, but if you are doing what you love, there is much more happiness there than being rich or famous.
author: Tony Hawk

quote: The world's most famous and popular language is music.
author: Psy

quote: If you are a leader, you should never forget that everyone needs encouragement. And everyone who receives it - young or old, successful or less-than-successful, unknown or famous - is changed by it.
author: John C. Maxwell

quote: The name Muhammad is the most common name in the world. In all the countries around the world - Pakistan, Saudi Arabia, Morocco, Turkey, Syria, Lebanon - there are more Muhammads than anything else. When I joined the Nation of Islam and became a Muslim, they gave me the most famous name because I was the champ.
author: Muhammad Ali

quote: In the future, everyone will be famous for 15 minutes.
author: Andy Warhol

quote: I'm more interested in being good than being famous.
author: Annie Leibovitz

quote: A voice is very intimate. It's something of your own. So there's always this fear, because you feel naked. There's a fear of not reaching up to expectations. As you become more famous, people come and expect to hear something extraordinary, so you don't want to disappoint them. I feel this sense of responsibility.
author: Andrea Bocelli

quote: Pleasure without God, without the sacred boundaries, will actually leave you emptier than before. And this is biblical truth, this is experiential truth. The loneliest people in the world are amongst the wealthiest and most famous who found no boundaries within which to live. That is a fact I've seen again and again.
author: Ravi Zacharias

quote: Fame can take interesting men and thrust mediocrity upon them.
author: David Bowie

quote: I don't want to be famous. I like to be able to sit in a cafe and watch the world go by and observe people.
author: Sophia Myles

quote: I've gotten books published. I've met famous people that are very nice. I look back and I say, 'Wow. Thank you, God, for giving me this gift. And thank you for helping me to keep going.'
author: Mattie Stepanek

quote: I always want to say to people who want to be rich and famous: 'try being rich first'. See if that doesn't cover most of it. There's not much downside to being rich, other than paying taxes and having your relatives ask you for money. But when you become famous, you end up with a 24-hour job.
author: Bill Murray

quote: I was never famous as a kid. That's the biggest difference between me and any other kid actor is that I wasn't famous as a kid.
author: Seth Green

quote: I probably should have a brand, but I think you can't get the best artists to work for you if you're branded. I get the trade-off, and I really would like to be more famous for my work, get more credit for my achievements.
author: Brian Grazer

quote: I think being famous is more of a hindrance, a constraint, than just letting yourself be free.
author: Martin Yan

quote: One of the downsides of being famous is that folks pay far more attention to you than they should. American celebrities are constantly under surveillance, and every word they say is subject to scrutiny. So, be careful what you wish for if you desire fame. No human being should be a goldfish.
author: Bill O'Reilly

quote: For famous men have the whole earth as their memorial.
author: Pericles

quote: When I was going for my graduate degree, I decided I was going to make a feature film as my thesis. That's what I was famous for-that I had my thesis film be a feature film, which was 'You're a Big Boy Now.'
author: Francis Ford Coppola

quote: I want to thank all the women who have worn my clothes, the famous and the unknown, who have been so faithful to me and given me so much joy.
author: Yves Saint Laurent

quote: My high-school coach Tony Reginelli was kind of famous for 'Reggie-isms,' kind of like 'Yogi-isms.' He always said if you want to be a good quarterback, when sprinting left you want to be amphibious and throw left-handed. I told him, 'You mean ambidextrous, coach?'
author: Peyton Manning

quote: Famous people are deceptive. Deep down, they're just regular people. Like Larry King. We've been friends for forty years. He's one of the few guys I know who's really famous. One minute he's talking to the president on his cell phone, and then the next minute he's saying to me, 'Do you think we ought to give the waiter another dollar?'
author: Don Rickles

quote: Any idiot can get laid when they're famous. That's easy. It's getting laid when you're not famous that takes some talent.
author: Kevin Bacon

quote: Once you become famous, there is nothing left to become but infamous.
author: Don Johnson

quote: Those who have known the famous are publicly debriefed of their memories, knowing as their own dusk falls that they will only be remembered for remembering someone else.
author: Alan Bennett

quote: A chair is a very difficult object. A skyscraper is almost easier. That is why Chippendale is famous.
author: Ludwig Mies van der Rohe

quote: There has been a time on earth when poets had been young and dead and famous - and were men. But now the poet as the tragic child of grandeur and destiny had changed. The child of genius was a woman, now, and the man was gone.
author: Tom Wolfe

quote: There's so many things I want to do. I want to work with great filmmakers, great actors, great scripts. And there's no reason for me to do anything short of that, because I'm 24, I don't have a family, I don't need to make tons of money, and I'm not dying to get famous.
author: Tobey Maguire

quote: I served the famous professors and scholars, and eventually they learned that the Reverend Moon is superior to them. Even Nobel laureate academics who thought they were at the center of knowledge are as nothing in front of me.
author: Sun Myung Moon

quote: I didn't know what to expect from a famous movie star; maybe that he'd be sort of stuck-up, you know. But not Gary Cooper. He horsed around so much... that I had a hard time painting him.
author: Norman Rockwell

quote: I became very famous, as a teenager, and my name and photo were splashed in all the media. They made me larger than life, so I wanted to live larger than life, and the only way to do that was to be intoxicated.
author: Cat Stevens

quote: Being famous gets me good concert tickets, good tables in restaurants, good seats at sporting events and that's really about it.
author: Fran Drescher

quote: Being famous is wicked. But it's better to be normal.
author: Rupert Grint

quote: I am the most well-adjusted human being I know. I started out this investigation as a very happy man with a great career. I've got the life people dream about: I am rich, I am famous, I've got a fabulous marriage to an absolutely, spell-bindingly brilliant woman.
author: James Ellroy

quote: I was with a famous comedian when a young fan walked up and asked for an autograph. The comedian blew him off. I'll never forget the look on the young boy's face. He was devastated.
author: Louie Anderson

quote: You know, one of the biggest thrills I have is when famous people recognize me from Taxi.
author: Marilu Henner

quote: It isn't false modesty when I say this, but although I am supposed to be a famous person it doesn't mean anything to me. I just sit at home and work.
author: Gyorgy Ligeti

quote: I think the driving thing was curiosity about the universe. That fascinated me. I didn't think anything about being famous or anything like that, I was just interested in the concepts involved.
author: Clyde Tombaugh

quote: Famous people come up to me, but I don't know who they are because my sight is so bad. It's always at the pool of the Four Seasons in Beverly Hills when I don't have my lenses in and my glasses are in my room.
author: Helena Bonham Carter

quote: If you look closely, there is no book more visual than Three Trapped Tigers, in that it is filled with blank pages, dark pages, it has stars made of words, the famous magical cube made of numbers, and there is even a page which is a mirror.
author: Guillermo Cabrera Infante

quote: Thus, after finishing high school, I started with high expectations and enthusiasm to study chemistry at the famous Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Zurich.
author: Richard Ernst

quote: Sometimes being famous gets in the way of doing what you want to do.
author: Johnny Mathis

quote: When you're famous, you don't get to meet people because they want you to like them when the present themselves to you, and you don't see the real people.
author: Cass Elliot

quote: I did grow up next door to Steve McQueen, who was a very famous movie star at the time, but as a kid it didn't impress me. We always had great fun with him. He would take us out on Sundays on his motorcycles, riding around in the desert; he was like a second father.
author: Herb Ritts

quote: Know the names of past and current artists who are most famous for playing their instruments.
author: Marilyn vos Savant

quote: I feel very strong as an individual, but as a famous footballer I know I am prone to certain things. All the media have a continuous interest for me. It varies from once a year to every day interest.
author: Ruud van Nistelrooy

quote: I am famous because I am an African American jazz artist.
author: Nat King Cole

quote: I didn't want to be famous. I just wanted to earn enough money to have a nice life and enjoy acting.
author: David McCallum

quote: The most famous person in my phone is Lindsay Lohan. We starred in 'Confessions of a Teenage Drama Queen' together in 2004 and we've stayed in touch.
author: Adam Garcia

quote: I'm famous by default. I came out of the womb, and people wanted to know who I was because of my parents.
author: Frances Bean Cobain

quote: The problem is, the more famous you get, the more people see you who didn't choose to.
author: Louis C. K.

quote: My dear Mama, you are definitely the hen who hatched a famous duck.
author: Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec

quote: Being rich and famous has never been my goal at all. I love to act and I want to be able to do really great parts.
author: Jenn Proske

quote: A window covered with raindrops interests me more than a photograph of a famous person.
author: Saul Leiter

quote: If I wasn't even famous or had any success, I would still wake up and put tons of make-up on, and put on a cool outfit. That's always been who I've been my whole life, so that's never gonna change. I love fashion. I love getting dressed up. I love Halloween, too.
author: Gwen Stefani

quote: I like photographing the people I love, the people I admire, the famous, and especially the infamous. My last infamous subject was the extreme right wing French politician Jean-Marie Le Pen.
author: Helmut Newton

quote: I think in the end, when you're famous, people like to narrow you down to a few personality traits. I think I've just become this ambitious, say-whatever's-on-her-mind, intimidating person. And that's part of my personality, but it's certainly not anywhere near the whole thing.
author: Madonna Ciccone

quote: Thank God I arrived the day before yesterday, the first of the month, at this port of San Diego, truly a fine one, and not without reason called famous.
author: Junipero Serra

quote: You do not want to get married at 22! Especially if you're famous, because girls are going to be throwing themselves at you.
author: Usain Bolt

quote: The hardest thing about being famous is that people are always nice to you.
author: Robert De Niro

quote: In American military cemeteries all over the world, seemingly endless rows of whitened grave markers stand largely unvisited and in silence. The gardeners tend the lawns, one section at a time. Even at the famous sites, tourism is inconstant.
author: Mark Helprin

quote: I find it weird the way people get so excited about celebrity. If my friends are on the phone, their friends will say: 'Is that kid from 'Love Actually' there?' And the phone gets passed round and I have to speak to this stranger asking: 'Are you famous?' I don't know how to answer.
author: Thomas Sangster

quote: In its famous paradox, the equation of money and excrement, psychoanalysis becomes the first science to state what common sense and the poets have long known - that the essence of money is in its absolute worthlessness.
author: Norman O. Brown

quote: Aristotle was famous for knowing everything. He taught that the brain exists merely to cool the blood and is not involved in the process of thinking. This is true only of certain persons.
author: Will Cuppy

quote: When you're rich and famous you are the dominant force in a relationship, even if you try hard not to be. I've talked of sacrificing everything for Fleetwood Mac, but I realize now that it is simply the only thing I've ever wanted to do.
author: Stevie Nicks

quote: I'm actually about as famous as a fourth division footballer from the 70s.
author: Dylan Moran

quote: I fear that, in the end, the famous debate among materialists, idealists, and dualists amounts to a merely verbal dispute that is more a matter for the linguist than for the speculative philosopher.
author: Moses Mendelssohn

quote: I try to become more humble and more myself with every year. There was a while when I got famous where I was so confused and my head was spinning.
author: Mira Sorvino

quote: It's always a little mind-boggling to realize that these famous actors know who I am.
author: Emily Blunt

quote: Being in 'Us Weekly' does not make you famous.
author: Bradley Cooper

quote: It's too late for me to get married before I'm famous. You never know people's intentions.
author: Carmelo Anthony

quote: Celebrity culture, it's everywhere, isn't it? It's reality TV, Big Brother. I didn't become a footballer to be famous, I became a footballer to be successful. I didn't want to be famous. Now people want to be famous. Why? Why would you want people following you about all day?
author: Ryan Giggs

quote: In fact, I'd just like to own something. Everyone thinks I'm glamorous, rich and famous but all I've got is some recording equipment and a battered old BMW.
author: Dido Armstrong

quote: I love being famous - it's phenomenal.
author: Dave Chappelle

quote: You want a hero in the music world? James Brown. He brought a feeling to music without really using words. He's just famous for his sound.
author: David Lee Roth

quote: I have a great job writing for 'The Office,' but, really, all television writers do is dream of one day writing movies. I'll put it this way: At the Oscars the most famous person in the room is, like, Angelina Jolie. At the Emmys the huge exciting celebrity is Bethenny Frankel. You get what I mean.
author: Mindy Kaling

quote: I got very famous for a minute and then it just all went away, you know? And for the last 20 years - you've got to pick yourself up and dust yourself off and then go on your merry way and start again, in a sense, and that's what I've been doing.
author: Colin Hay

quote: In the sixties, everyone you knew became famous. My flatmate was Terence Stamp. My barber was Vidal Sassoon. David Hockney did the menu in a restaurant I went to. I didn't know anyone unknown who didn't become famous.
author: Michael Caine

quote: It's sour grapes, I admit, I want to be more famous so people are examining my work couplet by couplet, you know what I mean? That's the level where I want to go.
author: Frank Black

quote: Anytime you cast a movie and you need someone famous in the lead part, you're a prisoner of whoever happens to be famous in the six-month window in which you're trying to get a film financed.
author: Alexander Payne

quote: I don't need to be wildly famous for my life to make sense.
author: Cory Monteith

quote: I can read a crowd pretty well. I know what to play and know how to keep it interesting for them and for myself as well. Most of the other DJs are more like producers so they become famous because they make hits and then they start DJ-ing. But I'm more from the other way around.
author: Tiesto

quote: I have no sense of being famous - you're just working. And then you'll have a random day in London when you'll do some press and it creeps into your awareness that this goes out - that what you do every day goes out to televisions right across the country.
author: Karen Gillan

quote: I was there when the quote-unquote golden age of musical theater was flourishing. I met everybody who worked in theater or was famous in theater from the '40s on.
author: Harold Prince

quote: If you wanna be famous, then it's okay if the music is fake, because fame isn't real.
author: Josh Homme

quote: I'm a regular person. I know a lot of people love being famous. I don't like it. I'm just chillin'. YouknowwhatI'msayin'?
author: Wale

quote: I grew up on my dad's sets, but I was never star-struck or desperate to be famous. I grew up being a worker. It took me a long time to realise that my work ended up being seen by people. As far as I was concerned, I was just in the family business.
author: Katharine Isabelle

quote: Why should it matter to us when wrestlers are found dead in their beds or seen limping around on two fake hips? Why should it matter to us that there's a list of modern wrestlers who died before the age of 50 - many of them famous - and that the list is more than 70 names long? Hey, there's always another wave of guys on the way. Always.
author: Bill Simmons

quote: Liverpool people are famous for liking clothes and fashion; they are very social and lively people, and we know that they like clothes.
author: Vivienne Westwood

quote: I think it would collapse my heart if I was super famous. I don't have the nerve for it, I'm too anxious. I don't know how you're not obsessed with how people perceive you, because they're real people, you know? You can convince yourself that they don't really know you, and that's true, but how can it not hurt your feelings?
author: Bo Burnham

quote: There are some famous people, and I've met them, who you might think are great, and then you meet them, and you discover that they not only have feet but heads of clay.
author: Anne Beatts

quote: Jack Palance was my distant uncle - that's the family gossip. Growing up, my family knew everything about his face getting burned and scarred in the military and how that mutilation led him to become such a famous 'heavy' in films. I prayed for good scars of my own. Not just acne scars.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: I think people I'm close to find it absolutely crazy that I'm famous.
author: Zayn Malik

quote: I've always been passionate about acting. I haven't been passionate about being famous.
author: David Alpay

quote: I liked myself much more before I got famous. I was much friendlier and had more energy.
author: Sia Furler

quote: John Muir, the famous naturalist, wrote in his journal that you should never go to Alaska as a young man because you'll never be satisfied with any other place as long as you live. And there's a lot of truth to that.
author: Tom Bodett

quote: First of all, plain and simple, you have no real idea of what it means to be famous until you become famous. It's a double-edged sword. Obviously there are a lot of amazing things about fame, but there are also a lot of challenging things about it.
author: Michelle Pfeiffer

quote: I'm an instant star. Just add water and stir.
author: David Bowie

quote: If there's anything more mortifying than being famous at 14, it's being washed up right after.
author: Moon Unit Zappa

quote: A library, to modify the famous metaphor of Socrates, should be the delivery room for the birth of ideas - a place where history comes to life.
author: Norman Cousins

quote: I had to do this very aggressive, big score in a very short time, and knowing that in the beginning, middle, and end would be this very, very famous theme, but I still had to weave a score around it and make it work as a score was really challenging.
author: Danny Elfman

quote: The same people who can deny others everything are famous for refusing themselves nothing.
author: Leigh Hunt

quote: Other famous men, those of much talk and few deeds, soon evaporate. Action is the dignity of greatness.
author: Jose Marti

quote: Pulp existed for 12 years before we got famous. Now, you could say that was just lack of imagination, but it's some kind of quality isn't it? Tenacity. You could also say it was sloth.
author: Jarvis Cocker

quote: The advantage of taking pictures of the famous is that they get published.
author: Elliott Erwitt

quote: I was the big, bossy older sister, full of enthusiasms, mad fantasies, desperate urges to be famous, and anxious to be a saint - a settled sort of saint, not one who might have to suffer or die for her faith.
author: Maeve Binchy

quote: I had a beautiful mother and a famous father, and I didn't know where I fit in.
author: Elle King

quote: They eat the dainty food of famous chefs with the same pleasure with which they devour gross peasant dishes, mostly composed of garlic and tomatoes, or fisherman's octopus and shrimps, fried in heavily scented olive oil on a little deserted beach.
author: Luigi Barzini

quote: Acting is not about being famous, it's about exploring the human soul.
author: Annette Bening

quote: Being famous is having the power to really implement positive change in the world, and it gives you the power to do what you want. I'm really grateful for it because I can play music and people will listen.
author: Sean Lennon

quote: Don't worry about writing a book or getting famous or making money. Just lead an interesting life.
author: Michael Morpurgo

quote: I seldom read anything that is not of a factual nature because I want to invest my time wisely in the things that will improve my life. Don't misunderstand; there is nothing wrong with reading purely for the joy of it. Novels have their place, but biographies of famous men and women contain information that can change lives.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: Since I was seventeen I thought I might be a star. I'd think about all my heroes, Charlie Parker, Jimi Hendrix... I had a romantic feeling about how these people became famous.
author: Jean-Michel Basquiat

quote: Mum loves me being famous! She is so excited and proud, as she had me so young and couldn't support me, so I am living her dream, it's sweeter for both of us. It's her 40th birthday soon and I'm going to buy her 40 presents.
author: Adele

quote: Yeah, I love being famous. It's almost like being white, y'know?
author: Chris Rock

quote: Before I was famous, when I was just working in Gilbert's Lodge, everything was moving in slow motion.
author: Eminem

quote: Celebrity was a long time in coming; it will go away. Everything goes away.
author: Carol Burnett

quote: The celebrity is a person who is known for his well-knownness.
author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quote: Passion for fame: A passion which is the instinct of all great souls.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Celebrity is the chastisement of merit and the punishment of talent.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: I do not like the man who squanders life for fame; give me the man who living makes a name.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Fame is the thirst of youth.
author: Lord Byron

quote: I think that when you are famous every weakness is exaggerated.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Celebrity distorts democracy by giving the rich, beautiful, and famous more authority than they deserve.
author: Maureen Dowd

quote: A very quiet and tasteful way to be famous is to have a famous relative. Then you can not only be nothing, you can do nothing too.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: What a heavy burden is a name that has become too famous.
author: Voltaire

quote: I have as much privacy as a goldfish in a bowl.
author: Princess Margaret

quote: I woke up one morning to find I was famous. I bought a white Rolls-Royce and drove down Sunset Boulevard, wearing dark specs and a white suit, waving like the Queen Mum.
author: Peter O'Toole

quote: If you want to be a rock star or just be famous, then run down the street naked, you'll make the news or something. But if you want music to be your livelihood, then play, play, play and play! And eventually you'll get to where you want to be.
author: Eddie Van Halen

quote: I've had to deal, a lot, with my own sense of intimidation at meeting famous people - especially actors, but really any famous people.
author: Charlie Kaufman

quote: I never wanted to be famous.
author: Dave Attell

quote: When famous people come up to you it's a bit weird, but it's an honour, really, when they recognise you and want to chat to you for a bit.
author: Wayne Rooney

quote: In the beginning, I loved being famous, but now I am tired of it and I would like to go back to my freedom.
author: Roberto Cavalli

quote: There are a lot of famous comedians from Liverpool, then obviously the Beatles, and the football club. That's what people in Liverpool are passionate about.
author: Ian Rush

quote: I'm willing to make compromises based on someone I think is the one, but I think it's psychologically important to people when they're famous to be the only famous person they know.
author: John Mayer

quote: I love being famous. It's almost like being white.
author: Chris Rock

quote: I had no desire to be famous; I just wanted to make the greatest music ever made. I didn't want anyone to know who I was.
author: Robert Smith

quote: I can deal with it now, but 13 is a tough age to be recognized and famous. It's a tough age, period.
author: Bill Skarsgard

quote: It's interesting because people assume that because I'm famous I know all famous people.
author: Daniel Radcliffe

quote: I have so much empathy for these young actors that are 19 and all of a sudden they're beautiful and famous and rich. I'm like, 'Oh my God, I'd be dead.'
author: Philip Seymour Hoffman

quote: There is this power that comes with being famous.
author: Rod Stewart

quote: Being famous before you've formed your personality, before you have that self-esteem, is dangerous.
author: Chris Evert

quote: When you're a famous, successful person at 16 years old, the rules change for you. Everybody is doing things for you to make life easier so you can go out and play. And I think you miss out on lot of growing up and a lot of reality checks.
author: Chris Evert

quote: I really feel like it's a travesty to make a child famous. I really do.
author: Joe Rogan

quote: I had a sense of who I was before I got famous.
author: Joe Rogan

quote: Exposure makes you famous, not just good work. Famous is being plastered everywhere.
author: Francesca Annis

quote: Being very famous is not the fun it sounds. It merely means you're being chased by a lot of people and you lose your privacy.
author: Colin Wilson

quote: When you look at Michael Jackson, there's nobody who loves him in that family, nobody. If they did, they'd tell him he didn't have to do all that in order to be famous. All he has to do is keep doing his music and be himself. Michael's been a little touched for about 20 years, but somebody needs to pull him aside and tell him they love him.
author: Jamie Foxx

quote: I never dreamt of being a musician for my livelihood. I certainly never would have wanted to be in the business that I'm in, meaning the fame and the glory, the glitter, the rock star, the famous part.
author: Eddie Van Halen

quote: Few would argue that Richard Dawkins is the world's most famous atheist, especially now that his friend and rival for the title, Christopher Hitchens, has now gone to meet his Maker.
author: Ray Comfort

quote: I always thought it was strange when these artists like Kurt Cobain or whoever would get really famous and say, 'I don't understand why this is happening to me.' There is a mathematical formula to why you got famous. It isn't some magical thing that just started happening.
author: Chad Kroeger

quote: Luckily, I think, I never really wanted to be famous, I just wanted to make movies.
author: Seth Rogen

quote: I remember, when I was an up-and-coming comic, how annoyed I would be when the famous guys would show up and just take everyone's spots.
author: Seth Rogen

quote: I'm coming out with a wine... I'm actually a restaurateur. I have Famous Famiglia Pizzeria that has opened up in the Sacramento airport. I'm also working with my business partner on opening up the Linnethia Lounge.
author: NeNe Leakes

quote: My ultimate dream is to become a famous star because I love to sing.
author: Lucy Hale

quote: I had a very happy childhood, happy teenage years and I was famous by the time I was 22. A charmed life.
author: Rik Mayall

quote: I am not hugely famous; I am not a name. For me, it's not the size of the role, it's the material and the people you are working with.
author: Ruth Negga

quote: On the banks of the Nile, the Rosetta branch, I lived an enjoyable childhood in the City of Disuq, which is the home of the famous mosque, Sidi Ibrahim.
author: Ahmed Zewail

quote: Athol Fugard became famous as a playwright, so although 'Tsotsi' the book was written in the '60s, it was only published in the '80s. It was then optioned pretty much every year by producers. I think the problem was that holding onto its period setting made it very hard to get finance.
author: Gavin Hood

quote: I don't see myself as a famous person.
author: Jess Glynne

quote: Martyrdom is the only way a man can become famous without ability.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: I don't like being recognised, I have no interest in being famous at all, I just do what I do. If I could be like Captain Kirk and beam myself up and then beam myself down, I would!
author: Bruce Dickinson

quote: We had an interesting thing at that first dinner. It was prior to the availability of several new hotels in Los Angeles, and we were more or less committed to the old Ambassador Hotel that has the famous Coconut Grove.
author: Lew Wasserman

quote: I'm following my dreams and doing what I love as a designer. I did not want to be one of those kids with a famous last name that doesn't do anything. That is very unfulfilling to me and I'm very happy.
author: Nicky Hilton

quote: I don't know about this thing - being famous. I haven't figured it out yet. It still mystifies me.
author: Helen Slater

quote: Yeah, I like to be the maker of the art. And I like and want the money. But I don't really dig being famous.
author: Liz Phair

quote: To put it simply - you know, a lot of people believe that the benefit of this job is fame and fortune. I believe that you pay for the fortune through the fame. I don't buy into the notion that being famous is somehow a good thing, or an exciting thing, or a wonderful thing.
author: Evangeline Lilly

quote: I don't think about being famous, really. Being an author, I don't generally get stopped as I walk down the street. It's not like being a movie star.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: I come from a family with a long tradition in shoemaking, and I still live in a region famous for its shoemakers. It is getting harder and harder to find skilled workers. There are no professional training institutes, so we have to train our own employees. And an apprenticeship takes three years.
author: Diego Della Valle

quote: I feel strongly about HIV/AIDS and children because I'm a famous singer, a public figure, and I'm a female and a mother. I have the responsibility and the passion to help out and do whatever I can.
author: Peng Liyuan

quote: My name is not big enough for people to go, 'Let me throw money at you because you're so famous!'
author: Nikki Reed

quote: When I was growing up I loved reading historical fiction, but too often it was about males; or, if it was about females, they were girls who were going to grow up to be famous like Betsy Ross, Clara Barton, or Harriet Tubman. No one ever wrote about plain, normal, everyday girls.
author: Kathryn Lasky

quote: Being famous is just like being in high school. But I'm not interested in being the cheerleader. I'm not interested in being Gwen Stefani. She's the cheerleader, and I'm out in the smoker shed.
author: Courtney Love

quote: Fame is a fickle food upon a shifting plate.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: We all want to be famous people, and the moment we want to be something we are no longer free.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quote: I never wanted to be famous. I only wanted to be great.
author: Ray Charles

quote: Power is not of a man. Wealth does not center in the person of the wealthy. Celebrity is not inherent in any personality. To be celebrated, to be wealthy, to have power requires access to major institutions.
author: C. Wright Mills

quote: I wanted to be a rich, famous rock-and-roll star in that order.
author: Dee Snider

quote: America is known as a country that welcomes people to its shores. All kinds of people. The image of the Statue of Liberty with Emma Lazarus' famous poem. She lifts her lamp and welcomes people to the golden shore, where they will not experience prejudice because of the color of their skin, the religious faith that they follow.
author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg

quote: Having bodyguards is just part of being famous, I think.
author: Dolph Lundgren

quote: Did you ever stop to think why cops are always famous for being dumb? Simple. Because they don't have to be anything else.
author: Orson Welles

quote: There's nothing to be said for being famous. It's a pain. You can't be rude to people - it's inexcusable not to be nice. Anyway, it's not in my nature. I was trained to be nice.
author: Terry Wogan

quote: My family was musical on both sides. My father's family had a famous flautist and a classical pianist. My mother won a contest to be Shirley Temple's double - she was the diva of the family. At 8, I learned how to play guitar. I used to play songs from the '20s, '30s and '40s in the kitchen for my grandmother.
author: Gloria Estefan

quote: I remember from my school days Archimedes jumping into his bath and displacing water and coming up with his famous principle, and of course Isaac Newton being hit on the head with an apple. In other words, this realm of human knowledge - which is mathematical, essentially - can have a playful visual element to it.
author: James Marsh

quote: When you become famous, being famous becomes your profession.
author: James Carville

quote: The hardest thing about being famous is that people are always nice to you. You're in a conversation and everybody's agreeing with what you're saying - even if you say something totally crazy. You need people who can tell you what you don't want to hear.
author: Al Pacino

quote: I'm famous for splurging at fast-food places. I'm currently obsessed with Taco Bell's bean and cheese burritos with extra green sauce and extra cheese. Gluttony!
author: Fergie

quote: Everybody think they're famous when they get 100,000 followers on Instagram and 5,000 on Twitter.
author: Meek Mill

quote: I'd probably be famous now if I wasn't such a good waitress.
author: Jane Siberry

quote: I lost some of my friends because I got so famous, people who just assumed that I would be different now. I felt like everyone hated me. That is the most unhappy time of my life.
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: I don't like being famous - it is like a prison. And driving for Ferrari would make it far worse.
author: Valentino Rossi

quote: The first pork-barrel bill that crosses my desk, I'm going to veto it and make the authors of those pork-barrel items famous all over America.
author: John McCain

quote: I think success right now is not about how famous you are or how much you're getting paid, but it's more about if you're steadily working and you're happy with what you're doing.
author: Sarah Hyland

quote: I'm busier than ever and it's led to new opportunities. But I've never worried about being rich or famous - for me, it's all about the dancing.
author: Anton du Beke

quote: I want to get so famous that I don't have to wake up in the morning. It'll probably never happen.
author: Gabriel Iglesias

quote: To seduce a woman famous for strict morals, religious fervor and the happiness of her marriage: what could possibly be more prestigious?
author: Christopher Hampton

quote: I'm the man that made wrestling famous.
author: Hulk Hogan

quote: When someone becomes successful or rich and famous, people perceive that person as being different. But I'm the same guy I've always been.
author: Barry Zito

quote: One thing about being famous is the people around you, you pay all their bills so they very rarely disagree with you because they want you to pick up the check.
author: Charles Barkley

quote: Fate is being kind to me. Fate doesn't want me to be too famous too young.
author: Duke Ellington

quote: Fame is like caviar, you know - it's good to have caviar but not when you have it at every meal.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: I have no use for people who throw their weight around as celebrities, or for those who fawn over you just because you are famous.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I'm not comfortable being around too many people. I don't like being out in public too much. I don't like going to bars. I don't like doing celebrity stuff. So most of the characters I play are people who don't always feel comfortable beyond their small circle of friends.
author: Adam Sandler

quote: You have to pretend that your life is a financial pleasure even when your autographs are bouncing.
author: Kinky Friedman

quote: Being a famous actress may give you a sense of being important, but believe me, it's just an illusion.
author: Juliette Binoche

quote: There's no difference between fame and infamy now. There's a new school of professional famous people that don't do anything. They don't create anything.
author: Ricky Gervais

quote: Glory is fleeting, but obscurity is forever.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Everybody wants to be famous, but nobody wants to do the work. I live by that. You grind hard so you can play hard. At the end of the day, you put all the work in, and eventually it'll pay off. It could be in a year, it could be in 30 years. Eventually, your hard work will pay off.
author: Kevin Hart

quote: The American Dream is a term that is often used but also often misunderstood. It isn't really about becoming rich or famous. It is about things much simpler and more fundamental than that.
author: Marco Rubio

quote: You might not make it to the top, but if you are doing what you love, there is much more happiness there than being rich or famous.
author: Tony Hawk

quote: The world's most famous and popular language is music.
author: Psy

quote: If you are a leader, you should never forget that everyone needs encouragement. And everyone who receives it - young or old, successful or less-than-successful, unknown or famous - is changed by it.
author: John C. Maxwell

quote: The name Muhammad is the most common name in the world. In all the countries around the world - Pakistan, Saudi Arabia, Morocco, Turkey, Syria, Lebanon - there are more Muhammads than anything else. When I joined the Nation of Islam and became a Muslim, they gave me the most famous name because I was the champ.
author: Muhammad Ali

quote: In the future, everyone will be famous for 15 minutes.
author: Andy Warhol

quote: I'm more interested in being good than being famous.
author: Annie Leibovitz

quote: A voice is very intimate. It's something of your own. So there's always this fear, because you feel naked. There's a fear of not reaching up to expectations. As you become more famous, people come and expect to hear something extraordinary, so you don't want to disappoint them. I feel this sense of responsibility.
author: Andrea Bocelli

quote: Pleasure without God, without the sacred boundaries, will actually leave you emptier than before. And this is biblical truth, this is experiential truth. The loneliest people in the world are amongst the wealthiest and most famous who found no boundaries within which to live. That is a fact I've seen again and again.
author: Ravi Zacharias

quote: Fame can take interesting men and thrust mediocrity upon them.
author: David Bowie

quote: I don't want to be famous. I like to be able to sit in a cafe and watch the world go by and observe people.
author: Sophia Myles

quote: I've gotten books published. I've met famous people that are very nice. I look back and I say, 'Wow. Thank you, God, for giving me this gift. And thank you for helping me to keep going.'
author: Mattie Stepanek

quote: I always want to say to people who want to be rich and famous: 'try being rich first'. See if that doesn't cover most of it. There's not much downside to being rich, other than paying taxes and having your relatives ask you for money. But when you become famous, you end up with a 24-hour job.
author: Bill Murray

quote: I was never famous as a kid. That's the biggest difference between me and any other kid actor is that I wasn't famous as a kid.
author: Seth Green

quote: I probably should have a brand, but I think you can't get the best artists to work for you if you're branded. I get the trade-off, and I really would like to be more famous for my work, get more credit for my achievements.
author: Brian Grazer

quote: I think being famous is more of a hindrance, a constraint, than just letting yourself be free.
author: Martin Yan

quote: One of the downsides of being famous is that folks pay far more attention to you than they should. American celebrities are constantly under surveillance, and every word they say is subject to scrutiny. So, be careful what you wish for if you desire fame. No human being should be a goldfish.
author: Bill O'Reilly

quote: For famous men have the whole earth as their memorial.
author: Pericles

quote: When I was going for my graduate degree, I decided I was going to make a feature film as my thesis. That's what I was famous for-that I had my thesis film be a feature film, which was 'You're a Big Boy Now.'
author: Francis Ford Coppola

quote: I want to thank all the women who have worn my clothes, the famous and the unknown, who have been so faithful to me and given me so much joy.
author: Yves Saint Laurent

quote: My high-school coach Tony Reginelli was kind of famous for 'Reggie-isms,' kind of like 'Yogi-isms.' He always said if you want to be a good quarterback, when sprinting left you want to be amphibious and throw left-handed. I told him, 'You mean ambidextrous, coach?'
author: Peyton Manning

quote: Famous people are deceptive. Deep down, they're just regular people. Like Larry King. We've been friends for forty years. He's one of the few guys I know who's really famous. One minute he's talking to the president on his cell phone, and then the next minute he's saying to me, 'Do you think we ought to give the waiter another dollar?'
author: Don Rickles

quote: Any idiot can get laid when they're famous. That's easy. It's getting laid when you're not famous that takes some talent.
author: Kevin Bacon

quote: Once you become famous, there is nothing left to become but infamous.
author: Don Johnson

quote: Those who have known the famous are publicly debriefed of their memories, knowing as their own dusk falls that they will only be remembered for remembering someone else.
author: Alan Bennett

quote: A chair is a very difficult object. A skyscraper is almost easier. That is why Chippendale is famous.
author: Ludwig Mies van der Rohe

quote: There has been a time on earth when poets had been young and dead and famous - and were men. But now the poet as the tragic child of grandeur and destiny had changed. The child of genius was a woman, now, and the man was gone.
author: Tom Wolfe

quote: There's so many things I want to do. I want to work with great filmmakers, great actors, great scripts. And there's no reason for me to do anything short of that, because I'm 24, I don't have a family, I don't need to make tons of money, and I'm not dying to get famous.
author: Tobey Maguire

quote: I served the famous professors and scholars, and eventually they learned that the Reverend Moon is superior to them. Even Nobel laureate academics who thought they were at the center of knowledge are as nothing in front of me.
author: Sun Myung Moon

quote: I didn't know what to expect from a famous movie star; maybe that he'd be sort of stuck-up, you know. But not Gary Cooper. He horsed around so much... that I had a hard time painting him.
author: Norman Rockwell

quote: I became very famous, as a teenager, and my name and photo were splashed in all the media. They made me larger than life, so I wanted to live larger than life, and the only way to do that was to be intoxicated.
author: Cat Stevens

quote: Being famous gets me good concert tickets, good tables in restaurants, good seats at sporting events and that's really about it.
author: Fran Drescher

quote: Being famous is wicked. But it's better to be normal.
author: Rupert Grint

quote: I am the most well-adjusted human being I know. I started out this investigation as a very happy man with a great career. I've got the life people dream about: I am rich, I am famous, I've got a fabulous marriage to an absolutely, spell-bindingly brilliant woman.
author: James Ellroy

quote: I was with a famous comedian when a young fan walked up and asked for an autograph. The comedian blew him off. I'll never forget the look on the young boy's face. He was devastated.
author: Louie Anderson

quote: You know, one of the biggest thrills I have is when famous people recognize me from Taxi.
author: Marilu Henner

quote: It isn't false modesty when I say this, but although I am supposed to be a famous person it doesn't mean anything to me. I just sit at home and work.
author: Gyorgy Ligeti

quote: I think the driving thing was curiosity about the universe. That fascinated me. I didn't think anything about being famous or anything like that, I was just interested in the concepts involved.
author: Clyde Tombaugh

quote: Famous people come up to me, but I don't know who they are because my sight is so bad. It's always at the pool of the Four Seasons in Beverly Hills when I don't have my lenses in and my glasses are in my room.
author: Helena Bonham Carter

quote: If you look closely, there is no book more visual than Three Trapped Tigers, in that it is filled with blank pages, dark pages, it has stars made of words, the famous magical cube made of numbers, and there is even a page which is a mirror.
author: Guillermo Cabrera Infante

quote: Thus, after finishing high school, I started with high expectations and enthusiasm to study chemistry at the famous Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Zurich.
author: Richard Ernst

quote: Sometimes being famous gets in the way of doing what you want to do.
author: Johnny Mathis

quote: When you're famous, you don't get to meet people because they want you to like them when the present themselves to you, and you don't see the real people.
author: Cass Elliot

quote: I did grow up next door to Steve McQueen, who was a very famous movie star at the time, but as a kid it didn't impress me. We always had great fun with him. He would take us out on Sundays on his motorcycles, riding around in the desert; he was like a second father.
author: Herb Ritts

quote: Know the names of past and current artists who are most famous for playing their instruments.
author: Marilyn vos Savant

quote: I feel very strong as an individual, but as a famous footballer I know I am prone to certain things. All the media have a continuous interest for me. It varies from once a year to every day interest.
author: Ruud van Nistelrooy

quote: I am famous because I am an African American jazz artist.
author: Nat King Cole

quote: I didn't want to be famous. I just wanted to earn enough money to have a nice life and enjoy acting.
author: David McCallum

quote: The most famous person in my phone is Lindsay Lohan. We starred in 'Confessions of a Teenage Drama Queen' together in 2004 and we've stayed in touch.
author: Adam Garcia

quote: I'm famous by default. I came out of the womb, and people wanted to know who I was because of my parents.
author: Frances Bean Cobain

quote: The problem is, the more famous you get, the more people see you who didn't choose to.
author: Louis C. K.

quote: My dear Mama, you are definitely the hen who hatched a famous duck.
author: Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec

quote: Being rich and famous has never been my goal at all. I love to act and I want to be able to do really great parts.
author: Jenn Proske

quote: A window covered with raindrops interests me more than a photograph of a famous person.
author: Saul Leiter

quote: If I wasn't even famous or had any success, I would still wake up and put tons of make-up on, and put on a cool outfit. That's always been who I've been my whole life, so that's never gonna change. I love fashion. I love getting dressed up. I love Halloween, too.
author: Gwen Stefani

quote: I like photographing the people I love, the people I admire, the famous, and especially the infamous. My last infamous subject was the extreme right wing French politician Jean-Marie Le Pen.
author: Helmut Newton

quote: I think in the end, when you're famous, people like to narrow you down to a few personality traits. I think I've just become this ambitious, say-whatever's-on-her-mind, intimidating person. And that's part of my personality, but it's certainly not anywhere near the whole thing.
author: Madonna Ciccone

quote: Thank God I arrived the day before yesterday, the first of the month, at this port of San Diego, truly a fine one, and not without reason called famous.
author: Junipero Serra

quote: You do not want to get married at 22! Especially if you're famous, because girls are going to be throwing themselves at you.
author: Usain Bolt

quote: The hardest thing about being famous is that people are always nice to you.
author: Robert De Niro

quote: In American military cemeteries all over the world, seemingly endless rows of whitened grave markers stand largely unvisited and in silence. The gardeners tend the lawns, one section at a time. Even at the famous sites, tourism is inconstant.
author: Mark Helprin

quote: I find it weird the way people get so excited about celebrity. If my friends are on the phone, their friends will say: 'Is that kid from 'Love Actually' there?' And the phone gets passed round and I have to speak to this stranger asking: 'Are you famous?' I don't know how to answer.
author: Thomas Sangster

quote: In its famous paradox, the equation of money and excrement, psychoanalysis becomes the first science to state what common sense and the poets have long known - that the essence of money is in its absolute worthlessness.
author: Norman O. Brown

quote: Aristotle was famous for knowing everything. He taught that the brain exists merely to cool the blood and is not involved in the process of thinking. This is true only of certain persons.
author: Will Cuppy

quote: When you're rich and famous you are the dominant force in a relationship, even if you try hard not to be. I've talked of sacrificing everything for Fleetwood Mac, but I realize now that it is simply the only thing I've ever wanted to do.
author: Stevie Nicks

quote: I'm actually about as famous as a fourth division footballer from the 70s.
author: Dylan Moran

quote: I fear that, in the end, the famous debate among materialists, idealists, and dualists amounts to a merely verbal dispute that is more a matter for the linguist than for the speculative philosopher.
author: Moses Mendelssohn

quote: I try to become more humble and more myself with every year. There was a while when I got famous where I was so confused and my head was spinning.
author: Mira Sorvino

quote: It's always a little mind-boggling to realize that these famous actors know who I am.
author: Emily Blunt

quote: Being in 'Us Weekly' does not make you famous.
author: Bradley Cooper

quote: It's too late for me to get married before I'm famous. You never know people's intentions.
author: Carmelo Anthony
